title: Power Platform Developer
description: A leading financial services organisation is seeking a Power Platform Developer to join their digital solutions team. This is a fantastic opportunity for a technically skilled and people-oriented professional who enjoys working across the full development lifecycle - gathering requirements, designing solutions, and supporting end users post-deployment. You'll play a key role in delivering modern, efficient, and scalable solutions using Microsoft Power Platform and Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE). This role is mainly remote, with travel to the Oxfordshire office just once per month. This is not just a technical role - it's also customer-facing, so you'll need to be confident working with stakeholders, understanding business needs, and communicating clearly and effectively.
benefits: Competitive salary up to £55,000 per annum (DOE)
Mainly remote - with only one day per month in the Oxfordshire office
Friendly and collaborative culture with clear career progression
Opportunity to shape impactful digital tools for a respected financial services provider
responsibilities: Develop and maintain Power Apps (Canvas and Model-driven), Power Automate flows, and Power BI reports tailored to business needs.
Extend and customise Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE), including entities, workflows and integrations.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and refine requirements through workshops and discussions.
Translate business needs into functional and technical designs, ensuring clarity between development and business teams.
Deliver user training, documentation and support to promote solution adoption and self-service.
Engage with non-technical stakeholders to explain features, limitations and benefits of proposed solutions.
Troubleshoot, optimise and enhance existing Power Platform and Dynamics CE applications.
Keep up to date with new features, best practices and Microsoft updates across Power Platform and D365 CE.
qualifications: Proven experience developing solutions with Microsoft Power Platform: Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power BI.
Strong hands-on experience with Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement (CE), including configuration and customisation.
Ability to engage with and present to stakeholders, both technical and non-technical.
Comfortable leading workshops, gathering requirements, and explaining solutions in plain language.
Good understanding of Dataverse, SharePoint, and the broader Microsoft 365 ecosystem.
Strong documentation skills - including process maps, technical specs, and training guides.
Excellent communication, interpersonal, and collaboration skills.
Self-motivated, proactive, and confident working independently in a remote-first setup.

title: Power Pages Developer (Power Platform)
description: This is a great opportunity to join a global leading consultancy. They are growing out their software engineering practice and seeking skilled developers with a deep understanding of the Power Platform (especially Power Pages) to help develop solutions for their wide range of customers. As a Power Pages specialist, you will contribute to the build, implementation, testing and maintenance of Power Pages, as well as building and integrating with the wider Power Platform. Using a cross spectrum of technical skills, you will be able to build applications, advise on solutions and drive adoption of Power Pages / Power Platform.
benefits: Grow within a leading global consultancy, with opportunities for personal and professional development.
Work with a team of experts who are committed to excellence and innovation.
Opportunities to attend Microsoft industry events
25 days annual leave + public holidays with option to purchase additional days
responsibilities: Lead the design, development and implementation of Power Pages solutions to meet user needs within a delivery team.
Be a technical specialist, producing high quality applications, both model driven and canvas, as well as enterprise scale Power Automate Cloud Flow solutions.
Understand governance principles and be able to advise on best practices for empowering every Power Platform maker.
Build solutions as part of an agile team using declarative tools, backed by Microsoft and using our own technical accelerators.
Help shape the Microsoft Business Applications technical capability by bringing your ideas for improvement forward and see them implemented.
qualifications: Good understanding of the configuration of Power Pages
An understanding of security best practices around Power Pages, with knowledge of items such as OWASP
Hands on experience with Dataverse and Dataverse for Teams as part of implementing Power Platform solutions.
Hands on experience in the setup of Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD), ideally using Azure DevOps.
A passion for and experience with industry-wide standards and best practices when designing and building solutions in the Power Platform.

title: Analista Desarrollador MS Dynamics Business Central
description: Analista Programador/a MS Dynamics 365 Business Central. Trabajo 100% remoto | Residencia en España. ¿Tienes experiencia en Microsoft Dynamics NAV / Business Central y buscas un proyecto estable, en crecimiento y con excelentes condiciones? Te presentamos una oportunidad dentro de un grupo sólido, con una fuerte apuesta por el ecosistema Microsoft Dynamics 365 y Power Platform, donde el desarrollo profesional, la estabilidad y el bienestar del equipo son una prioridad. ¿Qué ofrecemos? Contrato indefinido desde el primer día. Salario competitivo. Seguro médico privado + retribución flexible (cheques restaurante, guardería, etc.). Plan de carrera claro y acompañamiento real al desarrollo profesional. 100% remoto (se valora residencia en España para visitas puntuales a cliente). Horario flexible, con jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano. Proceso de selección ágil: máximo dos entrevistas. Tu rol: Te incorporarás a un equipo técnico senior, participando en proyectos de alto nivel vinculados al ecosistema Microsoft. Tendrás la posibilidad de aportar ideas, crecer profesionalmente y trabajar en un entorno que prioriza la calidad técnica y el equilibrio personal.
benefits: Contrato indefinido desde el primer día
Plan de carrera claro y acompañamiento real al desarrollo profesional
Horario flexible, con jornada intensiva los viernes y en verano
Proceso de selección ágil: máximo dos entrevistas
responsibilities: Incorporarse a un equipo técnico senior
Participar en proyectos de alto nivel vinculados al ecosistema Microsoft
Aportar ideas
Crecer profesionalmente
Trabajar en un entorno que prioriza la calidad técnica y el equilibrio personal
qualifications: Experiencia en MS Dynamics NAV / 365 Business Central
Perfil técnico con capacidad analítica
Ganas de aportar valor y trabajar en equipo
Residencia en España (preferente) o disponibilidad para visitas puntuales

title: Head of Dynamics
description: Head of Dynamics Bristol/Somerset (Hybrid) Looking to speak with Heads of Dynamics/Business Systems about an excellent new opportunity. The successful applicant will be responsible for managing the key business systems, leading projects and ensuring that our client's customers are getting the maximum out of their solutions.
responsibilities: Manage teams across full project life-cycle including D365 & Power Platform Solution Architects & Technical/Functional Consultants.
Explain benefits and possibilities of Power Platform to internal teams making sure that teams utilise low code capabilities to drive excellence.
Oversee and take leadership of design, development and implementation of business applications.
Enhance the reputation of company by representing our clients technical capabilities around the wider Microsoft Stack.
qualifications: Hands-On Experience with Dynamics Partner/Consultancy working in Solution Architect or more senior role.
Track record leading delivery for D365 CE & Power Platform (Sales, Marketing & Customer Service, Power Apps, Power Automate) etc.
Confident with Pre-Sales, leading discovery, technical demos etc.
Ability to influence senior leadership internally and external stakeholders advising on best solutions etc.

title: Head of Business Applications (D365 / Power Platform)
description:
Job Title: Head of Business Applications (D365 / Power Platform)
Location: Bath (Hybrid role)
Salary: £85 - £95k DOE
About the company: The company are a leading Microsoft Partner at the forefront of Data & AI innovation. They deliver transformative solutions that empower organisations to operate smarter and more efficiently. They are now looking for a visionary Head of Business Applications to lead their talented D365 & Power Platform to help shape the future of their application services.
benefits: Autonomy to shape the direction of the Power Platform practice
responsibilities: Lead and line manage a team of Dynamics 365 & Power Platform Solution Architects, Functional Consultants, and Technical Consultants.
Recruit and oversee bench resources (UK, nearshore, offshore) to meet peaks in demand.
Champion Power Platform internally, promoting low-code/no-code capabilities to drive operational excellence.
Drive adoption of AI solutions (especially Copilot) to automate manual tasks and focus on high-value work.
Represent Salocin Group's technical capabilities to Microsoft, enhancing our partner reputation.
Collaborate with clients to understand business goals and translate them into technical solutions.
Oversee and lead the design, development, and implementation of application-based solutions.
Support the Data, AI & Technology Consulting team as Lead Solution Architect, bridging high-level blueprints with detailed solution design.
qualifications: Proven experience managing Dynamics 365 & Power Platform teams.
Deep understanding of Power Platform's low-code/no-code potential.
Experience managing flexible resource pools across geographies.
Familiarity with AI tools like Copilot and their business applications.
Strong client engagement and solution design skills.
Excellent leadership, communication, and project management abilities.

title: Power Platform & Azure Data Developer (AI focused)
description: This is a great opportunity to join a Pharmaceutical company in London who are growing their team. The business are in the process of delivering some of their AI strategies and are seeking a dynamic and skilled Power Platform & Azure Data Developer with hands-on experience or exposure to AI.
responsibilities: Design, build, and maintain Power Apps (integrate them with Power Automate and in Power BI).
Integrate Power Platform solutions with other Microsoft services (e.g SharePoint, Dynamics).
Build and manage data pipelines using Azure Data Factory.
Support the deployment of cognitive services (e.g., Azure OpenAI, Azure Machine Learning).
Work closely with business stakeholders, analysts, and other developers to gather requirements.
Proven experience designing and deploying Power Automate workflows.
AI/ML exposure with basic understanding of AI concepts.

title: Systems/ Process Analyst
description:
Business Systems Analyst Manchester | End User | Permanent | £40,000-£50,000 + Benefits
Are you a Business Systems Analyst with a passion for making a difference?
We're working with a well-established end user based in Manchester that's investing heavily in digital transformation. They're looking to bring on board a Business Systems Analyst to help shape and deliver innovative solutions across their Microsoft ecosystem.
The Role
As a key member of the internal IT and transformation team, you'll be responsible for:
* Gathering and analysing business requirements to design and deliver Power Platform solutions.
* Collaborating with stakeholders across departments to translate needs into technical specifications.
* Driving automation and data visibility through Power Automate and Power BI.
* Supporting the full solution lifecycle from concept through to deployment and optimisation.
What You'll Need
* Proven experience in a Business Analyst or Systems Analyst role.
* Strong hands-on experience with Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI).
* Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Agile delivery experience is a plus.
What's on Offer
* A collaborative, forward-thinking environment with real ownership of your work.
* 5 days a week onsite in their modern central Manchester offices
* Career development opportunities and support for Microsoft certifications.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
benefits: 5 days a week onsite in modern central Manchester offices
responsibilities: Gathering and analysing business requirements to design and deliver Power Platform solutions
Collaborating with stakeholders across departments to translate needs into technical specifications
Driving automation and data visibility through Power Automate and Power BI
Supporting the full solution lifecycle from concept through to deployment and optimisation
qualifications: Proven experience in a Business Analyst or Systems Analyst role
Strong hands-on experience with Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI)
Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Agile delivery experience is a plus

title: Power Platform Architect
description: This is a great opportunity to join a specialist Power Platform consultancy who are growing their teams across Data, AI and Power Platform. As a Power Platform Architect, you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing cutting-edge solutions that leverage the full capabilities of the Power Platform. This will include leading pre-sales engagements and architecture for some of their customers. As a business they are active in the Power Platform community and there will be opportunities to attend industry events, and work alongside a team of Microsoft MVP's.
responsibilities: Lead the design, development, and implementation of Power Platform solutions to meet diverse client needs.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
Utilise your expertise in model-driven and canvas apps, as well as enterprise-scale Power Automate Cloud Flow solutions.
Advise on best practices for governance and empower Power Platform makers.
Integrate solutions with the wider Microsoft stack, including Azure and Dynamics 365.
Drive adoption of DevOps practices within the Power Platform ecosystem.
qualifications: Extensive knowledge of the Power Platform, including its technologies, capabilities, and limitations.
Hands-on experience with Dataverse and Dataverse for Teams.
Proven track record in setting up Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) using Azure DevOps.
Strong understanding of industry-wide standards and best practices for designing and building Power Platform solutions.
Leading pre-sales engagements with customers, promoting the benefits of the Power Platform.
Experience working in agile teams and delivering solutions in a commercial environment.

title: Consultant Power Platform
description: Vos principales missions : Développer et maintenir des applications Power Apps à destination des équipes métier (back-office, supply, retail). Automatiser les processus internes à l'aide de Power Automate en lien avec D365 F&O. Assurer le support technique, la documentation, et contribuer à l'amélioration continue des outils Power Platform. Environnement : Microsoft Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Dataverse). Intégration avec D365 F&O.
responsibilities: Développer et maintenir des applications Power Apps à destination des équipes métier (back-office, supply, retail)
Automatiser les processus internes à l'aide de Power Automate en lien avec D365 F&O
Assurer le support technique, la documentation, et contribuer à l'amélioration continue des outils Power Platform

title: Dynamics 365 CRM Professionals
description:
Job Opportunity: CRM & Microsoft Dynamics 365 Professionals
Location: South Africa (Remote or Hybrid - Johannesburg, Cape Town, Durban)
Type: Full-time | Contract or Permanent
Salary: Market-related with benefits and potential bonuses
We're currently partnering with several leading companies across South Africa and internationally who are expanding their CRM and Microsoft Dynamics 365 teams. As a specialist tech recruitment agency, we're looking to connect with skilled professionals who have hands-on experience with Dynamics 365 and are ready for a new challenge.
What we're hiring for: We're working on multiple roles across different industries - from consulting and professional services to retail, and enterprise environments. Current openings include:
- Dynamics 365 CRM Consultants (Functional and Technical)
- CRM Developers
- Solution Architects
- Business Analysts
- CRM Project Managers
Key experience we're looking for:
- Proven experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 CE / CRM (Sales, Marketing, Customer Service, Field Service)
- Solid understanding of CRM processes, design, and implementation
- Familiarity with the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI)
- Strong integration experience
- Ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions
- Relevant certifications (e.g., MB-210, PL-200, PL-600) are an advantage
Why work with us? As tech recruiters focused on the Dynamics and CRM space, we work closely with both niche start-ups and large enterprise organisations. This means we can offer:
- Access to roles that aren't always advertised publicly
- A streamlined recruitment process with honest feedback and guidance
- Support from recruiters who understand the Microsoft tech ecosystem
- Remote and hybrid working opportunities depending on the client
Requirements:
- 5+ year's experience in Dynamics 365 CRM or related technologies
- Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills
- Based in South Africa with the right to work locally
- A proactive, solution-oriented approach
responsibilities: Work as Dynamics 365 CRM Consultant, Developer, Solution Architect, Business Analyst, or Project Manager
Design and implement CRM processes
Integrate Dynamics 365 with other systems
Translate business requirements into technical solutions
Engage with stakeholders
Participate in consulting, professional services, retail, or enterprise projects
qualifications: 5+ years experience in Dynamics 365 CRM or related technologies
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills
Based in South Africa with the right to work locally
Relevant certifications (e.g., MB-210, PL-200, PL-600) are an advantage
Proactive, solution-oriented approach

title: Dynamics Business Central - Developer
description:
Senior Dynamics 365 Business Central Developer
Up to £70k + Benefits | Remote or Hybrid | UK-Based
My client is a fast-growing Microsoft Partner looking to bring on board a Senior Business Central Developer to play a key role in delivering high-quality customisations and technical solutions across a range of BC projects. You'll work closely with functional consultants and the wider technical team to build scalable, reliable and high-performing solutions for clients across multiple industries.
benefits: Flexible working - fully remote or hybrid
Clear progression pathway into Lead Developer or Technical Architect roles
Supportive team culture with regular knowledge sharing and development opportunities
responsibilities: Design, develop and implement custom solutions within Dynamics 365 Business Central (AL and C/AL)
Lead the technical development of end-to-end BC implementation and upgrade projects
Build and maintain extensions, integrations and custom modules to meet client-specific needs
Collaborate with functional consultants to translate requirements into robust technical specifications
Upgrade legacy NAV systems to Business Central, ensuring minimal disruption and improved functionality
Optimise performance and ensure code quality through testing, peer reviews and best practice development
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for deployed solutions post go-live
Keep up to date with the latest BC features, tools and development practices
Mentor junior developers and contribute to internal development standards
qualifications: Strong hands-on development experience with Dynamics NAV and Business Central (AL and C/AL)
Proven experience working in a Microsoft Partner or consultancy environment
Solid understanding of Business Central architecture and best practice coding standards
Experience with API integrations, web services and extensions
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams

title: Lead Dynamics 365 Business Central Consultant - Remote
description: Join a dynamic team dedicated to delivering exceptional solutions. We are seeking a Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central Functional Consultant to join our client's team. This is a permanent role based in the USA, offering the opportunity to work remotely with approximately 25% travel. The ideal candidate will play a vital role in enhancing business processes and implementing innovative solutions using Dynamics 365 Business Central for varied clients.
responsibilities: Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into Business Central functionality
Provide expert insight into Dynamics 365 Business Central best practices to drive project success.
Support system integrations and customizations to optimize workflow efficiency.
Train and assist end-users on system functionalities, ensuring smooth adoption.
Stay updated on Dynamics 365 Business Central developments to drive continuous improvement.
Configure, map, and test EDI transactions (X12, EDIFACT, XML, etc.) for smooth data flow

title: Power Platform & Dynamics CRM Developer
description: We are looking for a skilled Power Platform & Dynamics CRM Developer to build and maintain custom solutions using Microsoft Power Platform and Dynamics 365. You'll work closely with business teams to design, develop, and implement business process automation, custom apps, and data solutions.
responsibilities: Develop solutions using Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, and Dynamics 365 CRM.
Customize and extend Dynamics CRM functionality (Sales, Customer Service).
Automate workflows and business processes with Power Automate.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define requirements and deliver solutions.
Troubleshoot, test, and maintain applications.
Create reports and dashboards in Power BI.
Stay current on Microsoft technologies and industry trends.
qualifications: Experience with Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI) and Dynamics 365 CRM.
Strong knowledge of Dynamics CRM customization, Power Platform connectors, and data integration.
Proficient in JavaScript, C#, and web technologies.
Ability to work with cross-functional teams and gather requirements.
Microsoft certifications in Power Platform/Dynamics 365 (preferred).

title: Dynamics 365 CE Solutions Architect
description: My client is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Dynamics 365 CE Solutions Architect to join our growing team in Miami, Florida. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on designing and delivering innovative CRM solutions that empower field teams and streamline operations.
benefits: Opportunity to work on cutting-edge Microsoft technologies
responsibilities: Architect and implement end-to-end solutions using Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement, with a focus on the Field Service module
Design and develop custom applications using the Power Platform (Power Apps, Power Automate, Power Pages)
Integrate D365 CE with external systems via APIs, and build responsive, user-friendly interfaces using HTML and JavaScript
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements, define architecture, and ensure successful project delivery
Provide technical leadership and mentorship to development teams
qualifications: Experience with Dynamics 365 CE, including hands-on work with the Field Service module
Strong proficiency in Power Platform tools: Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power Pages
Experience connecting to and consuming RESTful APIs
Solid front-end development skills with HTML and JavaScript
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Microsoft certifications in Dynamics 365 and/or Power Platform (preferred)
Experience in agile project environments (preferred)
Familiarity with Azure services and DevOps practices (preferred)

The successful applicant will be responsible for managing the key business systems, leading projects and ensuring that our client's customers are getting the maximum out of their solutions.
responsibilities: Manage teams across full project life-cycle including D365 & Power Platform Solution Architects & Technical/Functional Consultants.
Explain benefits and possibilities of Power Platform to internal teams making sure that teams utilise low code capabilities to drive excellence.
Oversee and take leadership of design, development and implementation of business applications.

Track record leading delivery for D365 CE & Power Platform (Sales, Marketing & Customer Service, Power Apps, Power Automate) etc.
Confident with Pre-Sales, leading discovery, technical demos etc.
Ability to influence senior leadership internally and external stakeholders advising on best solutions etc.

title: Senior Dynamics Developer
description: Currently seeking a D365 CE Developer, with experience working on D365 CE - Sales & Marketing, to join a forward-thinking team at a well-established end user! This position offers the successful candidate the opportunity to take on a leading role in designing and developing Dynamics 365 CE enhancements, working closely with a like-minded team and applying their technical skills to have a significant impact on their D365 CE/CRM projects. My client offers a flexible, hybrid working model (2 days a week - Coventry) with an excellent starting salary and benefits.
responsibilities: Working on varied projects to develop and implement Dynamics 365 CE
Engage with stakeholders to gain a more detailed understanding of the requirements, where required.
Bringing fresh ideas for improvements and influencing how they are implemented.
Create and build solutions as part of an agile team, ensuring a collaborative approach to achieve exceptional results.
qualifications: Strong experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM, including customisations and configurations.
Proficiency in C#, .NET, and JavaScript for plugin development and extending the platform.
Proven track record in automating business processes within D365.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues and end users.
Understanding of the full software development life-cycle, with a keen eye for detail and quality

title: Dynamics FO Consultant
description:
Finance and Operations Consultant
A multinational distributor is looking to hire an F&O Consultant to support its global roll out and improvement of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (F&O). With the business employing thousands of members across the globe, prepare to join a large scale project with multinational impact.

About the Role
This is an in house position suited for a skilled professional who enjoys problem solving, improving systems, and leading technical decisions. The role sits at the center of the company's ERP landscape, focusing on architecture and performance enhancements.
benefits: A collaborative and multicultural work environment
Flexibility through hybrid working and adjustable hours
Exposure to international projects with room to grow
An in house role offering variety, ownership, and long term stability
A company culture that values input, initiative, and development
Competitive salary and benefits package up to €110k
responsibilities: Manage F&O environments and coordinate updates, builds, and releases
Be the direct link between technical and functional experts
Communicate with external partners
Design and maintain the ERP system architecture with future growth in mind
Lead and manage custom developments across third-party add-ons
Turn business requirements into technical solutions
Optimise system performance, scalability, and security
qualifications: Experience working with F&O in a technical lead or architect role
Strong understanding of ERP architecture
Knowledge of Azure
Confident communicator who works well with global teams
Able to take initiative and work independently
Fluent in English

title: Dynamics 365 CE Developer
description:
Job Title: Dynamics CE/CRM Developer
Location: Gothenburg
Company: Leading Microsoft Gold Partner
Are you a skilled Dynamics CRM Developer ready to deliver innovative CRM solutions that make an impact? Join a renowned Microsoft Gold Partner where you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, collaborate with top professionals, and contribute to transformative projects for high-profile clients.
Your Role:
As a Dynamics CRM Developer, you will:
- Develop and customize Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions to meet client needs.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver scalable solutions.
- Extend CRM functionality through custom code, plugins, workflows, and third-party integrations.
- Conduct unit testing, debugging, and code reviews to ensure quality and performance.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest Dynamics CRM features and provide innovative solutions.
- Create and maintain technical documentation, including design documents and user manuals.
What's in It for You?
Join a team that values innovation, growth, and work-life balance:
- Competitive Salary: Attractive package with performance-based incentives.
- Health & Wellness: Comprehensive health insurance and wellness programs.
- Flexibility: Hybrid working model with flexible hours.
- Growth Opportunities: Ongoing training, certifications, and professional development.
- Team Culture: Collaborative environment with supportive colleagues and leaders.
- Exciting Projects: Work on prestigious client engagements using the latest technologies.
- Perks: Generous vacation, paid time off, social events, and employee recognition programs.
Why Join Us?
As a Microsoft Gold Partner, we're committed to excellence, innovation, and empowering our employees. You'll have the chance to advance your career while delivering impactful solutions that drive success for our clients.
If you're ready to take the next step in your career as a Dynamics CRM Developer, apply now and become part of a team where your skills and creativity make a difference!
benefits: Comprehensive health insurance and wellness programs
Hybrid working model with flexible hours
Ongoing training, certifications, and professional development
Collaborative environment with supportive colleagues and leaders
responsibilities: Develop and customize Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions to meet client needs
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver scalable solutions
Extend CRM functionality through custom code, plugins, workflows, and third-party integrations
Conduct unit testing, debugging, and code reviews to ensure quality and performance
Stay up-to-date with the latest Dynamics CRM features and provide innovative solutions
Create and maintain technical documentation, including design documents and user manuals
qualifications: Fluency in Swedish (written and verbal) is essential
Proven experience developing and customizing Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions using .NET, C#, JavaScript, and SQL
Strong understanding of CRM architecture, including entity relationships, workflows, forms, and security models
Hands-on experience with tools like Visual Studio, XRM Toolbox, and the CRM SDK
Familiarity with web technologies (HTML, CSS, REST/SOAP web services) and integration tools
Knowledge of data migration and CRM integration techniques
A degree in Computer Science or a related field (equivalent experience considered)
Microsoft Dynamics CRM certifications (e.g., MB-210, MB-220, MB-230) are a plus
Excellent problem-solving, collaboration, and communication skills
